p: The histopathological findings confirmed the biochemical and the electrophysiological observations. Histopathological changes typically observed in L-NAME-induced hypertensive rats, such as increased monocyte and platelet adhesion, thickening of the vascular wall, aggregation of inflammatory cells in organs [ 47, 48], were less marked or absent in animals treated with either A. digitata extract or captopril. Altogether, these findings suggest that A. digitata extract has antihypertensive properties in L-NAME-induced hypertensive rats.
